intro: Stylidium lehmannianum var. gracile, commonly known as the slender triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred petals that resemble a trigger mechanism. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its striking appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
